goals.question: What is the distribution of departure delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of departure delays and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between departure delays and arrival delays?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of departure delays vs arrival delays
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between departure delays and arrival delays. It can also help us identify any patterns or trends in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight distances and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of flight cancellations by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which airlines have the highest number of flight cancellations and identify any potential patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?
goals.visualization: Box plot of flight delays by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of flight delays by airline and identify any potential outliers or patterns.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['departure_delay'] = pd.to_numeric(data['departure_delay'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['departure_delay'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['departure_delay'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Departure Delays')
    plt.axvline(data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['departure_delay'].median():.2f}")
    
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delays')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of departure delays?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['departure_delay'], data['arrival_delay'])
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay')
    plt.ylabel('Arrival Delay')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between departure delays and arrival delays?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Distance'].plot.hist(bins=30, edgecolor='black', color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['Distance'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['Distance'].median():.2f}")
    plt.title("What is the distribution of flight distances?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Flight Distances")
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Group data by airline and count cancellations
    cancellations_by_airline = data.groupby('airline')['cancellations'].sum()
    
    # Create bar chart
    ax = cancellations_by_airline.plot(kind='bar', color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    
    # Set title and labels
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Airline')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Cancellations')
    
    # Rotate x-axis labels for better readability
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    # Add legend
    ax.legend(['Cancellations'])
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['flight_delay'] = pd.to_numeric(data['flight_delay'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['flight_delay'])]
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    data.boxplot(column='flight_delay', by='airline', ax=ax)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?')
    plt.suptitle('')
    plt.xlabel('Airline')
    plt.ylabel('Flight Delay (minutes)')
    plt.legend(title='Airline', loc='upper right')
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
